characters: FROM HAIL OF SMOKE AND BURNING CASH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun might be down, but the city is baking. Waves of heat ascend into the sky while an unmarked van navigates ACROSS the SCREEN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver is EDDIE DOMINGUEZ. And riding in the passen- ger seat is a man dressed in black, called FOUCHET. He looks to the rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's taking so long back there?

dialogues.speaker: REAR
dialogues.text: Where the rest of the gang waits.      NOAH, KUNI, FERGUS and CASPER. All dressed in black      like Fouchet, excep for ANDY. He stands and shows off      his Miami PD unifo His English is poor, yet he's got     a big, happy-to-be- along grin on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do I look? Like the real thing, yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Step back and lemme get a good look at you.

dialogues.speaker: REAR VIEW MIRROR
dialogues.text: THROUGH which Eddie can watch the action. Andy steps further to the rear, almost to the door, facing the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me again about your assignment, Andrew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the decoy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right you are. Over the seat Fouchet reveals a SHOTGUN.     BOOM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy's body is blown through the rear doors as the van turns a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He dials 911 on his cellular phone.     Fouchet sounds distressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please help! I just saw a policeman shot! Send help. Hurry! I'm at the corner of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stream of PD CARS haul past, lights blazing and SIRENS on full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Crowds moving up and down Ocean Blvd. Beautiful people walking. Beautiful people watching. MUSIC BLENDS from nightclub to nightclub. A POLICE RADIO, holstered to the hip of a street cop. It CRACKLES with:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report of an officer down. Be advised, all units. Corner of Lennox and Taylor. Slipping by the street cop: Intro MARCUS BURNETT and MIKE LOWREY. They shimmy through the hotel doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the buffed DESK MANAGER gets off the phone to greet the effeminate pair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good evening.    I'm Mike --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- And I'm Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're lookin' for a couple of our Latin friends who checked in a little while ago. You might remember them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No chest hair. And packin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.   But our guest list is private.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, didn't they say? There's going to be party! It's

dialogues.speaker: B.Y.O.B.O. --
dialogues.text: (leans in close)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The B.O. stands for baby oil.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you can come. Get off after you get off? All three of them laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, now that you mention it. They were kinda cute. Suite 202.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey and Burnett clip on their shields and unholster their guns. The posing is over. This is business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the table are two briefcases. Each opened. One containing cocaine. The other, cash. A pistol next to each. REVEAL the dealers. Two young Dominicans seated across from the TV, getting high, drinking beer and laughing out loud at the Spanish language version of Time Traxx. Then -- BANG! The door's kicked in and Lowrey's first through. Burnett on backup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Police!   On the floor! But the dealers split, rolling out of their chairs.   One goes left and the other, right.

dialogues.speaker: B8 BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Lowrey tackles the first dealer to the floor. A LATINA girl screams. Lowrey unfortunately looks and takes a hard fist across the ear from the dealer. Angered, Lowrey swings his pistol up underneath the perp's jaw and knocks him through the bathroom door. Lowrey cuffs him to the sink. Meanwhile... Back to:

dialogues.speaker: LIVING ROOM
dialogues.text: Burnett's in trouble. He's still got his gun in hand. But the other dealer has him pinned underneath the legs of a chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey! Burnett stomps the bad guy's instep. The guy buckles. Burnett rolls away and stands in front of a window, just in time to see the angry Dominican heading straight for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett   and the other dealer come crashing out onto the balcony,   then over onto an awning, rolling off onto som occupied   cafe tables. Patrons scatter. Uniformed cops move in   to assist.

dialogues.speaker: LOWREY
dialogues.text: appears soon after, walking down the hotel steps, leading the Latina in his cuffs, and wearing his jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scraped, bruised, pissed)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice backup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? We TILT UP as POLICE HELICOPTER flies overhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As OPENING TITLES RUN and MUSIC POUNDS -- we FLY OVER the causeways, waterways and hotels that line the beach. Something is happening in the balmy city as we CRUISE downtown and ZERO IN ON...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HELICOPTER ROARS low over the rooftops toward the causeway bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the helicopter passes over, he appears  from behind a large exhaust port. Casper, Ferguson, and   Noah behind him, all wearing high-tech miner's helmets  with built-in radio headsets, and an array of high-tech  tools.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time. The team crosses the roof to a huge air conditioning unit. They climb inside, carrying a six-foot-long metal case and what looks like a black scuba tank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Though it's windy and cramped in here, at least it's cool. From a prone position, Fouchet puts on his night vision goggles and reveals a palm top computer. Quickly he scrolls through the labyrinthine schematics loaded onto the unit. TILT DOWN to see the various ducts. Endless. Bottomless. But clearly, Fouchet's a man who knows his way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seemingly empty.   From squad rooms to locker rooms to booking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OFFICER BILL O'FEE, 50s, reads a magazine and drinks coffee. Video monitors in front of him show the different lockers inside the evidence room. We see one room with stacks upon stacks of heroin.

dialogues.speaker: IN AIR UNIT
dialogues.text: The team, attached to cables, slide into the building's guts and disappear. STATIC CRACKLES:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in.     Start the video.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kuni finds the conduit he's looking for, splices it, cuts into it with a Makita battery-powered circular saw, then attaches a handheld high-8 video machine and starts the video feed. The unit is strapped to the conduit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The MONITORS FLUTTER, then STABILIZE.    Turning the page O'Fee sugars his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An air vent smashes to the floor.    Two guys pull the metal case inside the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BANG! Another air conditioning vent grate crashes to the floor. Their headlights blazing, two men clamber into the cavernous room, Fouchet along with Casper. This is the special Drug Holding Room: The lock cuts like butter and the steel door is yanked open. One hundred million dollars in heroin. Each kilo brick is stamped with a distinctive octopus logo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Deputy Dog?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He made us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then do him, now!

dialogues.speaker: GUARD STATION
dialogues.text: Sure enough.    As O'Fee stands from his desk --

dialogues.speaker: VENT ABOVE
dialogues.text: Where Ferguson is waiting with an air-powered tranquil- izer gun. He cuts loose a silent round that strikes O'Fee at the base of the neck. O'Fee stops. But before he can think to reach back at what hit him, his knees buckle and he drops to the linoleum. Out cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one he moves backwards through the various levels of locks, torching each to look as if they'd entered the evidence room from inside the PD station. Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: TRACH CHUTE ROOM
dialogues.text: Noah removes what looks like a flattened bobsled with large urethane wheels from the metal case and places it inside the air shaft. Ferguson attaches the black "scuba tank," labeled "NITROUS OXIDE," to a valve. This is connected to a metal-cased cable system that is piston-gunned into the floor.

dialogues.speaker: HEROIN LOCKER
dialogues.text: Fouchet and Casper moving the stacks of heroin, placing them in the air duct on the bobsled. Once they're done, we hear RADIO GARBLE, then the sled is cabled to the con- traption. A button is pushed -- and the sled is pulled at breakneck speed through the duct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bag after bag drops down the trash chute and tumbles into an open-roofed van where the last of the gang, Eddie Dominguez, waits with the ENGINE RUNNING.

dialogues.speaker: IN AIR DUCT
dialogues.text: The sled rockets by again -- WHOOSH -- loaded with more bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Casper and Fouchet throw the last of their gear down the chute and ride the sled out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One! Two! Three! Four! They all land atop the bags. Eddie GUNS the VAN, which rolls up the ramp and out the garage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Haul ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the ledge the tape runs out and RECORDER EXPLODES. Pieces scatter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van drives off into the golden sunrise of Miami. TITLES END.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of those expensive condo buildings on Brickell Avenue with a circular driveway and a uniformed doorman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA TRACKS THROUGH expensive and trendy bachelor's lair. State-of-the-art everything, gorgeous artwork. Spectacular view. CAMERA STALLS ON -- a perma-plaqued newspaper clipping with a photo depiction of Lowrey and Burnett in front of a giant pile of black heroin, thumbs up to the camera. The headline reads: MIAMI PD RECORDS RECORD HEROIN BUST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Lowrey wakes up in a king-sized bed. The pain on his face and empty, scattered bottles tell us he's nursing a world-class hangover. He sits up, carefully, holds his aching head. Hearing BREATHING, Lowrey lifts the sheet next to him.

dialogues.speaker: REVEAL THE LATINA
dialogues.text: The one from the Colony Hotel. He drops the sheet back over her head, reaches over to his nightstand and grabs an industrial-sized bottle of Excedrin. Empty. He opens the nightstand drawer, extracts another bottle. Empty. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                                9.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All marble and brass. Lowrey opens up his medicine cabinet. Locating a new bottle of aspirin... he suddenly realizes that the SHOWER is RUNNING. Confused, he pulls open the shower curtain slightly. From the back, it's an incredible body, then she turns around and it's --

dialogues.speaker: THE LATINA
dialogues.text: Yes.   The very same as the one he just saw in bed.    Wh

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Morning. Lowrey closes the curtain on her. Frowns at this impossibility. He steps back into the doorway and peers over at his bed. Yep, same face. Twins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaking his head)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man... He tears open the bottle of aspirin.    Chug-a-lugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett and his young wife, THERESA, are jarred awake by the CLOCK RADIO BLARING on the night stand. Theresa gropes for RADIO, shuts it OFF. Burnett playfully gropes for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're always saying we should spend more quality time together. Well, I got the time... and you got the quality... She laughs.   He kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can remember when we used to do it every morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was how we got a three bedroom house filled with little Burnetts. She crawls from bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been over a week since I've had some quality time! BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                             10.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium. There's the two-and-a-half-year-old, MEGAN, who's taking bites of food and spitting it back out, looking at it, then putting it back in. Six-year- old JILL, who is playing refrigerator magnet games on the fridge. And Marcus in the middle of it all, deftly side- stepping his eight-year-old boy, QUINCY, who appears on roller blades whizzing through with a hockey stick and ball. He body-checks Jill against the ice box.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, Quincy pushed me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Mike showed me that move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy, never-you-mind. And take those things off in the house! Jill, stop with the book and eat your breakfast. (then, exasperated)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, why do I always have to discipline the kids? You play bad cop for a second. Alongside the kitchen screen door we see Lowrey's PORSCHE ROAR to a stop in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids, knock it off... or your momma's gonna whoop your butts! Theresa laughs in spite of herself as the kids continue to fight. Into this craziness enters Mike Lowrey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah, family life. Reminds me why I stay single. JILL & QUINCY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Mike!   Uncle Mike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hiya, kids.   Mornin', Theresa. Lowrey pecks Theresa on the cheek.   She recoils.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't kiss me, Lowrey. I don't know where those lips were last night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                            11.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell us some stories, Uncle Mike. You know, the one about the stewardess?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't go tellin' my son about your sleazy sex life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I promise, Theresa. I only tell your husband about my sleazy sex life. The TELEPHONE RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want him knowing about it either! Gives him ideas. (answers the phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Oh, sure. Which one of them do you want? Lowrey accepts the phone from Theresa and talks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're live with Lowrey. (listens for a long beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Scuse me, Captain. I think you mean to say, 'Get the fuck down here, please?' Burnett automatically pulls on his jacket, hugs the children as Lowrey hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not so fast. You were going to take the kids to school today, remember, hon? I have a job interview... Lowrey rolls his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett's following Lowrey and the kids out his front door when his neighbor, DICK, accosts him from across the hedge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                          12.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Marcus. Did you know we got busted into again last night? When are you gonna do something about this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Dick. How many times I gotta tell you? I don't work robbery. I'm in Narcotics. Meanwhile, Lowrey's holding the car door open as the kids pile into the jump seat in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get your sticky fingers all over my windows... and keep your feet off the seats, I just had the leather conditioned. The kids ignore him, gleefully continuing to squirm around. Before Burnett can get into the car, Theresa runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus... I need you to stop at Save-More on the way home and pick up exactly what's on the list. She hands Burnett a long list.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, baby.   Damn. Lowrey shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey and Burnett pull up in Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: B39 INT POLICE STATION
dialogues.text: Lowrey and Burnett walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I'm lyin' I'm dyin'. Her sister came down and posted the girl's bail. And later? Man, talk about special effects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What special effects? BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                         A12A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell you later -- Mornin', Francine. Where's the smile?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/20/94                                12

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: FRANCINE, a civilian employee of the narcotics unit. She's got pictures of her children parked around her computer desktop. And though dowdy would be a compliment, she's usually got a pleasant smile for the boys. Except today...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Evidence room. Howard's waiting for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your kids are lookin' sharp, Francine. She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett and Lowrey know there's big problems when, at the bottom of the stairwell, the first thing they see is a yellow police tape and fingerprint team dusting a torched lock. Problem is, the building is nothing but cops and it looks as if the entire department is stomping all over the evidence room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's see. There's Sleepy, Grumpy, Sneezy, Happy, Bashful... Now, who could we be missin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could it be... Dopey? Both laugh hysterically, while:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it ain't the leftovers from Miami Vice. Fashion casualties, lost somewhere in the eighties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the women really go for that. Really, they do. As Burnett and Lowrey duck the tape, they note a very groggy O'Fee over in the corner being attended by a paramedic team. He's still out cold. An oh shit look passes between the two partners.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another torched lock noted as Burnett and Lowrey enter with Sanchez an Ruiz behind them. The room is emptied. Captain HOWARD appears. He's short, has a military haircut, and has a minor Napoleon complex and a major in paranoia.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice of you to roll in. And nothing particular is going on around here except, maybe, your dope is gone. That's right. The biggest dope bust in the history of this department up and walked out of this locker, along with maybe my job and the two of yours if we don't get the shit back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can't be happening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/21/94                              14.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So here's what we're gonna do. Since it was originally your case, you two guys are on point. Sanchez and Ruiz, you back them up with whatever they need. Groans all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I guess we should start with the C.I.s and the perps from the original case. But hell if I know any dope dealers with the balls to pull this off. They're either dead or in the lock-up pending trial.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's O'Fee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, he'll be just fine. From the side appears a cigar-chewing Internal Affairs suit named SINCLAIR. He circles close to Burnett and Lowrey, waving his cigar as he speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Name's Sinclair. Internal Affairs. He's our new proctologist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, what's got me confused is, why risk leaving a witness? Why not kill O'Fee instead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because maybe this guy knows if you kill a cop the whole department'll get up his ass hard and fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And who knows that better than anybody else? Cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not sayin' this was an inside job. Cops wouldn't pull this shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/21/94                              15.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not just cops. Narcotic cops. For example, the S.N.D. You've got access. You've got wherewithall. And most importantly, you've got the connections. Who else would know how to unload a hundred million dollars worth of heroin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fuck you and your cheap, off- the-rack suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Enough. I.A.'s in it and there's nothing we can do about it. If any of this leaks, the shit's gonna hit our biggest fan. Remember him? The mayor? He created us and you can bet your jobs, boys, he'll rip us into little cop pieces. I figure we got seventy-two hours to find the dope and keep our jobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing like a little old-fashioned incentive.

dialogues.speaker: BURNETT
dialogues.text: He walks to the center of the room and kneels to those four bolt holes in the floor. He fingers the paraffin filler, then looks above to the air conditioning grate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the air conditioning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what about it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lowrey)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you should go ahead, crawl up and give it a good look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/21/94                    15A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For one, it was your idea. Two, while my suit's fresh, you're dressed for the occasion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't say nothin' about my clothes. I paid for these.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I don't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not on a cop's salary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett crawls up with some help from Lowrey below, stalling the oscillating fan with his cuffs and crawling through. The first thing Burnett notices are the track marks from the bobsled cutting through a coating of dust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I got some weird track marks in here. Then Burnett notes a manufacturing stamp at the joint. It reads: ORONA AIR CONTITIONING SYSTEMS, INC.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who appears from below, framed in the vent shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice and cool up there, Burnett? Comfy? Maybe there's a new career for you in building maintenance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey and Burnett with their desks opposite each other. The CAMERA CIRCLES while they lay the arm on some informants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's gonna be a lotta cash when the dope hits the street. We want you to put the word out through your bank and hustle the account.  You help us, maybe we can see about getting those R.T.C. auditors off your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Cedras. You and I both know you're the number one importer for the Simona Brothers. And I'm tellin' you there's a buttload of H on the move and someone's gonna wanna stick their dick in it. So it better not be yours. You hear something? You call us. You hear nada? You better get the fuck outta town. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                             17

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey's driving, no seatbelt, doing his usual speed- weaving. Burnett's hanging onto the handle above the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a fucking lead. So now that we've done the obvious, we need a shortcut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   So we talk to Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh uh. Not this time. I'm tired of you working pussy into everything we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a better idea?

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Lowrey and Burnett arrive in the unmarked car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once-colorful stucco, fading and crumbling. Scrappy Cuban fighters spar and work out on the aging equipment while, at the same time, a remarkable amount of amazing- looking women work out on weight bags, shadow box with trainers. Curves and sweat, any way you look.

dialogues.speaker: BURNETT AND LOWREY
dialogues.text: enter. And while Lowrey cruises amongst the sweaty flesh as if it were a day in the park, Burnett lags. Maybe he has been married too long.

dialogues.speaker: MAX LOGAN
dialogues.text: she's doing sit-ups on an incline bench.     She notices Lowrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Mike.   You come to work-out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Raincheck, darlin'. Gotta talk. Anyplace we can go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                            18.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Equipment room. Hiya, Marcus. How's your wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This room isn't enclosed. It's walled by wire mesh. Private enough, though. Max shuts the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry to come around only when I need something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget about it. I owe you the rest of my life, Mike. Lowrey just gives her an "oh please" look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't be lookin' at me like I'm getting all sentimental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I didn't open my mouth. Listen, there's some major, major ill shit happening down at the P.D. Lotta heroin involved. There's gonna be a lotta cash involved, too. Gonna be some happy motherfuckers around that wanna party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you want me to check around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just make a coupla calls. See what's what. Don't be doin' no wild shit. Just call me if you hear something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett is surrounded by beautiful, sweaty women. One of them is a fabulous BLACK WOMAN with legs so long and toned, they're not just legs, they're weapons. Burnett can't help but stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                           19.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's Max's friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh.    I love cops. The other girls are suddenly interested, too.   Burnett swallows and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know? I'm a cop. I shot somebody just last week. Didn't kill him, just shot him in the ass. Stone cold looks from them all. They walk away with Burnett giving a "what did I say" look. Lowrey appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, that was really smooth. Think you could do that again? (as they start walking)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ohh. I'll tell you, when the wife gets meaner, the grass gets greener.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green ain't the color I was thinkin' of. More of a coco puff. Just real shiny, thick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they head toward their car, Burnett's BEEPER SOUNDS. He switches it OFF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Damn! The woman's got fuckin' radar on my ass. Sensed me lookin' at another woman. Bet she wants me to pick up Huggies 'stead of those baby Garanimals that they wear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think anybody could be that married. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                            19A

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett drives cautiously while both he and Lowrey bob to Ice-T's "COP KILLER." They get a kick out of the song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (complies)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miami's the perfect town for you, Burnett. You drive like a one- hundred-seven-year-old lady with her turn signal on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I plan on living to be old just like 'em. Rubbin' Ben Gay on my joints and everythin'. An old guy passes them even though his car is pulling an Airstream camper behind it. Lowrey can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gonna let every old motherfucker pass you? Or just the ones with big-ass trailers draggin' behind? A-c-c-el-er-ate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have a death wish like you. I  got a family that counts on me.  A mortgage to pay. And I'm not sayin' it's me, but most of the guys in the station think you're some rich kid playin' cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who said that? Burnett mumbles an answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If somebody's talking about me, I wanna know... Man, I'm so sick of this. I don't apologize for nothing I do. I get up early and take it to the max every day. I'm always the first guy through the door. And the last guy to leave a crime scene. So fuck 'em all. I could give a shit what those boot lickin', brown-nosin', ass kissin' motherfuckers think of Mike Lowrey. What can Burnett say to all that, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                          20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you, man. He lets loose a big grin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, fuck you, Marcus. The RADIO CRACKLES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-one? I got that address for you on the air conditioning company. Oh, and Theresa called, she added something to your grocer list: Muppets toothpaste. Bubble gum flavor. She says Quincy doesn't like mint. Lowrey rolls his eyes, glances at Burnett, who's embarrassed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Roger that. Gimme the address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orona's been working out of his house. He's at...

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: Burnett and Lowrey step from their unmarked car and start up the steps to this stony, estate-sized house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air conditioning business has been good to Orona. Lowrey rings the bell.   They wait.   No answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we can leave a note or we can break and enter --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Hear that? I thought I heard Orona beating his wife. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                              2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey kicks the door in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh.    No alarm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, man.    Did you cut one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, man.    Musta been you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not me. Lowrey and Burnett look at each other and draw guns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dead guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is unlocked and swings open easily to reveal Lowrey and Burnett in an instant, repulsed reaction to Orona's body which sits upright in his office chair, the body grotesque and bloated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now what? A sickened Burnett goes over to the body, speaking to Orona as if he were alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are the drugs? (no answer)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where... are... the... drugs? (shrugs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ain't sayin' nothin'. He must be guilty of somethin'. Meanwhile, Lowrey's got   no problem with the dead body. He tries opening a desk   drawer, but Orona's rigor morti stiffened knee is in the   way. So Lowrey gives it a shov and the chair swivels.    Orona's dead arm sweeps the lam off the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa. Watch where you're swinging them dead arms, Orona. You're gonna fuck up your own crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                             22

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lowrey braves the body and gingerly pokes around his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch what you touch.   That's evidence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not touching. Browsing... Mr. Orona. You've got the right to remain silent. Anything you say'll surprise the shit out of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (finds small notepad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jai-Alai. Dog track. Lotta bookies. Phone numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemme guess. Guy does the air conditioning contract for the P.D. He'd have the plans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He trades the plans for his paper and gets popped by the perps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Works for me. Now can we go? I'm gonna puke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Palm Beach styled antique.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As antique as the exterior. Well-tended. Lots of potted ferns amongst rattan and craftsman era furniture. Enter --

dialogues.speaker: LOIS
dialogues.text: Matronly, in her flowered dress and bare feet, she carries a tea tray toward the kitchen. Max is following.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                          23.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Lois. Make some calls. That's all. I'm looking for a party with fresh cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing any favors for Mike Lowrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then call it a favor for me. Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, then. I'll make the calls. But you have to talk to Julie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll talk to her but she's not into it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you have to say is that she'll be getting paid for what she already does for free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/21/94                                 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she'll say, 'There's one big difference. I do it for fun. I don't ever have to blow anyone I don't like.'

dialogues.speaker: FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: It swings open to reveal JULIE MOTT, 24, just as beautiful as Max and dressed to be undressed. She drops one of those big, model's shoulder bags to the floor and gazes curiously back at Lois and Max. Her ears are burning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   So what'd I miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hotel bustles with activity.     Cabs pull up.   Door Bellhops. Rich people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Max and Julie walk through...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bad moods after a bad round of golf... I had blonde hair, then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Ronny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sex addict.     Coke addict. Redhead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were a redhead?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only for two days. It wasn't even a phase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.   Mark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/21/94                       25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh. Bad loser and bad, bad blonde. Farrah, frosted kinda big bad blonde. Oooh. Max laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's my point. I remember my hair phases more than I remember the men. (playful, sarcastic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, a party in a Biltmore Hotel suite? Yeah, that'll really rock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a favor for a friend. If it sucks after a half-hour, we'll split and head to South Beach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A favor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, my friend Mike Lowrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (rolls her eyes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike Lowrey. Not again. Will you just have sex with the man and get it over with.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, right.     You're in love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's never gonna happen. I'm great at turning lovers into friends. But turning friends into lovers, I can't do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I don't date cops. They never have enough money and they're always too tired to screw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I've told you before, my Mike isn't like that. If I were in real trouble, Mike Lowrey is the only person I'd call. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/21/94                                 2

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upon arrival, the door is opened to Max and Julie by Eddie Dominguez, instantly recognizeable from the heist. Eddie's pouring champagne into a glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max, my little carina. It's been a long time. And who's your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie.   Julie. Julie sizes him up.    Good taste.   His suit.   Bad tast His personality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Julie. Come in, Max. Welcome to the Al Capone suite. Thev're stepped into a grand, opulent suite. High arched ceilings. Magnificent antique furniture. Killer view. No party guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not kidding. Capone had the place fixed up with secret passages and hidden stairways. Can you dig it? People were actually killed within these walls. He's moved behind them and reveals a concealed staircase that rises into darkness.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Not happy. Stuck at the Biltmore with a Scarface wannabe. She looks over at Max. Let's get outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?   I need to use the bathroom. Julie crosses to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, Maxi. I thought you dropped off the edge of the earth and died. Either that or you moved to California.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/21/94                           25B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Eddie. Looks like we're way too early. How's about we come back later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Don't go yet. We can party. Just us three. Look at what Eddie's got to play with. From underneath the couch Eddie reveals a single key of heroin. Max tries to hide the recognition that she just hit paydirt on the very first try.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where she's silently cursing Max for getting her into this lame-ass party when she hears MUFFLED VOICES outside the bathroom. Instinctively, Julie peers through the louvered shades.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH SHADES
dialogues.text: She sees Eddie opening the door to Fouchet.   Casper and Noah follow him inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie is instantly nervous in the presence of Fouchet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the girl, Eddie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a hooker --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name's Max. (outstretched hand)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just a friend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could use a friend who looks like you. Turn around. Lemme get a good look. Max tries to size this man, then chooses to submit. She does her best model's turn. Slowly giving him a view of the rear when -- Fouchet draws a PISTOL -- BAM BAM!! Max tumbles forward and CRASHES through a GLASS TABLE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instant horror. Julie saw Max killed and retreats to the opposite side of the bathroom in total fright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, Fouchet swings the gun onto Eddie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a fucking idiot. Hookers talk. Now, is that my dope?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (freaked)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our dope... That was the deal, yeah? Right. Until we got the money -- BAM!   Fouchet SHOOTS Eddie in the knee.   Eddie screams!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You fucker... fucker fucker fucker!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have four more days until I make the deal. When it's done you get your money. Now, what part don't you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man.   You need me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't need anybody. I got three little angels looking over my shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: EDDIE'S CHAIR
dialogues.text: Fouchet UNLOADS THREE MORE SHOTS.    BAM BAM BAM!!!   Blo spatters onto Casper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw, man. You got blood on my new suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever hear of dry cleaning? Now, shut the fuck up, check for the rest of my dope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Half-panicked, half-trying to keep her head. There's no way out of the bathroom. All she can do is switch off the light. And now she sees Casper's shadow as he approaches.

dialogues.speaker: DOORKNOB
dialogues.text: As it turns. Julie suddenly reaches for it and pulls open the door with a surge. Casper stumbles in, his face hitting the hard tile with a crunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Making her move, she hauls as fast as she can across the room. Aiming for that secret fireplace door.

dialogues.speaker: FOUCHET
dialogues.text: Wheels with his PISTOL, unloads the clip. BULLETS are catching up, ripping up the couch and the rest of the suite. Julie dives right into the secret door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Twisting. We MOVE WITH Julie as she races through it, heart in her throat. She comes upon some old metal stairs, a sliver of light at the top, and clambers up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High atop the Biltmore, this is where the passageway leads out to. A door flies open and Julie appears. Panicked. Wind whipping all around her. A bird flies by, startling her. Hearing the APPROACHING THUGS, Julie sprints as best she can across the Spanish-tiled roof. Turns to see --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noah and Casper appear in the Bell Tower. Noah scans the roof, takes aim and FIRES, but he's too far away -- and Julie disappears behind a rise in the roof.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She steps towards the edge of the roof. Quickly peers over. A huge swimming pool, five stories down.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: She weighs the options.   Jump or die.

dialogues.speaker: NOAH AND CASPER
dialogues.text: As they try running across the harsh-tiled roof...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look. My fuckin' shoes.      My fuckin' Italian shoes! Then Julie prays silently, takes a running start and leaps from the roof. SLOW-MOTION as Julie flies through the air like some glamorous angel.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT
dialogues.text: as Julie breaks the surface with a huge splash. The water swirls as her aching body struggles to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie breaks water like a dolphin, gasping for breath. She's dazed and confused, but alive -- for the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fouchet reaches down and picks up Max's purse, then flicks it across the room to the defeated pair of Casper and Noah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a hooker. Find out who she works for. Find out where she lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Several police cars, an ambulance and a coroner's van are now parked in front, the lobby awash in strobing red and blue lights. CAMERA PANS PAST the crime scene personnel to find Burnett and Lowrey pulling up to the scene. They get out and thread their way through the growing chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is a mess. Homicide detectives are already on the scene, drawing chalk circles around casings on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: On the far side of the commotion, the two bodies have been photographed and are covered. Chief Howard is conferring with a technician who's dusting for prints.

dialogues.speaker: BURNETT AND LOWREY
dialogues.text: enter. But Sanchez and Ruiz are already on the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys watch where you're walking or you'll fuck up the crime scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks like you're already doing that. Burnett's quick to point out the trail of bloody foot- prints Ruiz just tracked across the carpet.

dialogues.speaker: CHAMPAGNE GLASS
dialogues.text: Which Julie left on the fireplace mantel. Lowrey's quick to note the two separate shades of lipstick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dead. A hood registered as Eddie Dominguez and some Jane Doe. But the table over there's covered in high-grade dope. Sound familiar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we    got us a witness. Over here    I got two different shades of    lipstick on one champagne    glass. Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: BURNETT
dialogues.text: He drops the sheet on Eddie's body, then moves over to Max's. He doesn't know it's her until --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus, no...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatcha got?

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Burnett drops the sheet, turns and puts a protective shoulder between Lowrey and the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?     Who is it? Lowrey instintively pushes past his partner and kneels at the body. He pulls back the sheet. Right now he could kill the shooter, then himself. In that order. Lowrey's eyes well up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shoulda told you to be careful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open and out step Burnett and Lowrey into a lobby full of cops. Lowrey goes straight to the front desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eddie Dominguez. I want his phone calls. He flashes a badge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You pay the bill you can see his phone calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     Maybe I wasn't polite enough. With a flashing right jab, Lowrey pops the snooty Clerk. After the Clerk finds his feet, eyes peering over the counter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't fuck with him right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Walking down the steps toward their car, Lowrey passes the phone sheet off to Burnett.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three calls to Lois Fields. I'm going to stop by her place and tell her a bedtime story. You can catch a ride with Howard. Lowrey jumps in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh... Alright, you check out Lois, then check in --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Replete with balcony and billowy curtains, the old-styled madame LOIS FIELDS sits up on her bed covered in pillows and exotic stuffed animals. She thumbs an old, leather- bound looseleaf binder full of modeling photos and resumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Jimmy. But you can't have her. Shelly only models and that's all... That's right. Like I always say, some girls do, some girls don't, and the rest you can't afford -- (line cuts out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello? Jimmy... Jimmy? Suddenly, the power is cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CRASH!   The front DOOR breaks down.   Noah appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey parks the Porsche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door is open and the deadbolt looks smashed with something heavy like a sledgehammer. Lowrey pulls a radio with one hand and his pistol with the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                               33.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into mic)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is twenty-one two. I'm gonna need back-up at 614 Reach Road. Lowrey eases inside the darkness of the doorway. He checks the lights, but the power is off. Slipping the radio into his coat pocket, he returns with a mini- flashlight and begins to clear a path, doorway by doorway, then moving up a wide stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard is sitting at the edge of the desk while Burnett is on the phone with Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you check parole? How about F.B.I. or D.E.A.? They're supposed to be compliant with our requests? And where the hell's Lowrey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hand over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Following this Lois Fields lead. I just paged him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The madame? What's it with this guy? It's always girls, girls, girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as Theresa screams)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Theresa... No, he wasn't talking about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOVING THROUGH the doors of the master suite where a ligh breeze blows through balcony of sheer curtains, Lowrey turns ever-so-slowly with his flashlight following a beat behind. The beam comes to rest on a bludgeoned body laying on the bed amongst huge pillows and exotic stuffed animals. The telephone cord is wrapped around her neck. Lowrey's closer inspection reveals --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94

dialogues.speaker: LOIS'S CLIENT BOOK
dialogues.text: Where an obvious page   and photo have been ripped out. Julie's. Lowrey goes    for the phone. Picks it up with his handkerchief. No    dial tone. So he drops the receiver and heads out   of the room. But just as he reaches the doorway -- Suddenly -- Lowrey's BEEPER SOUNDS. He jumps.    Reaches down to switch it off when -- From out of those billowing curtains -- Noah! Sledgehammer in hand, he swings at Lowrey, who instinc- tively blocks and ducks as the hammer misses and crushes the bannister railing. It gives under Lowrey's weight, who reaches over and traps the sledgehammer, only to find one of Noah's hammy fists battering him behind the ear until -- The rail finally gives way. Lowrey falls and crashes onto a Craftsman table covered in antique picture frames. It collapses underneath him. Then --

dialogues.speaker: LOWREY'S RADIO
dialogues.text: Laying next to him.    It SQUAWKS LOUDLY...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over radio)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulling up now, twenty-one-two. Give us your twenty in the residence... twenty-one-two. Do you copy. Twenty-one-two... The CAMERA LIFTS to reveal that Noah has vanished.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard can't believe his ears.       Is every cop's wife a pain in the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa, I know it was my idea. I know I was the one who wanted a little quality time.  It's just that this can't wait.  Can't I just wake you up when I get home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                               35.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Lowrey's PHONE RINGS.    But Howard's close so he picks i up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about fuckin' time. (answers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Howard here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This small place is a typical, party girl pit  stop. Very little furniture, but closets overflowing with  clothes. Magazines, beer bottles, unmade bed. Wet and   frightened Julie scurries around with a cordless phone at  her ear, locking all the doors and windows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to Detective Lowrey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's not here. How can I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can get me Detective Lowrey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't another paternity case, is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.     It's another murder case.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did this happen at the Biltmore Hotel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen! I just saw my best friend murdered. I'm soaking wet. I'm alone, I'm scared and I'll only talk to Mike Lowrey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't hang up. Lemme find him. (hand over phone)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page Lowrey. Find out where he is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa.     I gotta go. Burnett hangs up and redials Lowrey's pager. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/21/94                             35A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey, battered and barely conscious, is loaded into an ambulance. His BEEPER SOUNDS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's so frustrated she's about to hang up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to come downtown! I don't want police protection! If you can't gimme Detective Lowrey I'm just gonna blow town!
