dialogues.text: Hey, Mike. Who's the guy in all the pictures? Burnett turns. And there behind Julie is a wall full of photos that he's never, ever noticed. Nearly all of Lowrey. All ego.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That guy? Well, that's Marcus Burnett, my partner. Burnett gets closer and must look around until he finds the singular photo of the two of them. It's in a shitty frame, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's the two of us, see?     Me'n'... (gestures to photos)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... My partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Mike. I've known a lotta guys. And I've seen a good number of their bedrooms, okay? But I've never seen... I mean, look at it. It's like a shrine to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/23/94 PM                          54.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. Sure, I can see how it looks that way... But you see... you see... It's uh... a cop thing. (then it comes)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because I've put a picture up there for every time Marcus has saved my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Saved your life?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I save his life. He saves mine. He's got the same thing in his house. Pictures of me. More, even. Good family man, that Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but Mike. This is like a lot of pictures. I mean, this isn't something by the bedstand. This is a whole wall... And I know Max said you were just friends. That's why I was thinking, maybe... you could be... gay. Burnett reacts, then recovers with...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? Gay?   Are you outta your mind?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean to offend you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a good thing that I'm secure in my manhood to see that you don't mean that. You know how many women I've had in that waterbed? Check the waves as they go by. Count 'em. (turns back to living room)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, mug shots?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett and Julie are sitting at the computer looking at mug shots dialed in from the police database. She fiddles with, but does not eat her salad, while stealing sideways glances from the computer screen to the nasty, bologna sandwich Burnett is eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shooter said four days until he makes the deal. What else did he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somethin' weird. Sounded like three angels... He wasn't worried because he had three little angels on his shoulders tellin' him something. I didn't get the rest. (back to the mug shots)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting tired of looking at ugly people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a few more and we can take another break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't wanna take a break. Then we'd have to talk and I got nothing to say to a cannibal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was a living, breathing consciousness. It felt joy. Sadness. Maybe it even had a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What had a name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That flesh you're shoveling into your mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (stops chewing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's just bologna.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was alive. Some farmer  fed it. Got it to trust him. Then  blew its brains out, dumped it in a cement mixer with a ton of carcinogens and now you're   eating it.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Burnett never looked at it that way.     He starts to put down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. At least finish it so I won't have to look at it. (back to the screen)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's look at some more ugly people.

dialogues.speaker: COMPUTER SCREEN
dialogues.text: It's a photo of Noah along with his extensive rap sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. Hold it. Go back... That's him! That's one of 'em.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure? Julie nods.    She's certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Howard, please.    It's Lowrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Mike -- Lowrey looks down to find little Megan pulling at his leg She shows a picture book.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I have to go now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey is standing just outside, portable phone in hand. He's trying to keep his voice low.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94                                57

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just talked to Marcus. The girl just I.D.'d one of the shooters --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Mike!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Hang on, Cappy. (starts reading from the book)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Prudence and she has to go potty. This is a potty. Everyone has to poop and when they do they use the potty. (turns page)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommies poop. (turns page)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddies poop. (turns page)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Captain Howard poops. Even doggies poop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett is cleaning up dog shit    from one of Lowrey's Persian rugs. The stain won't     come out. So Burnett tries a can that he's grabbed.     It foams. Julie appear with a pile of clean laundry in    hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your dog took a shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you used Pledge to clean it up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks at can)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lemon Pledge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that makes a big difference. You just varnished that into the fabric. I'm sure it works great. Burnett doesn't quite know what    to do with the wad of dog poop in paper towels still    in his hand. Julie snatches it from him and heads    for the bathroom. Burne follows. He suddenly realizes     that the clean clothes his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94                            58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cleaned my clothes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just threw them in with mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You cleaned my clothes? He's all appreciative until he notices something dis- turbing. A shirt of his has a large bleached area on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shyly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a little accident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is my favorite shirt.   My lucky shirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. As Burnett starts to walk away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Mike. I don't have any of my clothes. I wanna go back to my place to get some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not going to happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need apparel. That and I need some food that's something more than a cold, slab of fear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slab of fear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All you got in the place are frozen steaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright. I left my wallet at the office so I'll give you some cash tomorrow. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94                              59.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quincy and Jill are rapt as Lowrey does a quick security sweep, checking closets and window locks as he tells a bedtime story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... so your daddy and I are trapped in this crack house in Little Havana. These dudes were real mean mothers... and they start coming at us with knives... Now I'm scared, thinkin' I'm out for the count when in comes your daddy like a Miami hurricane --

dialogues.speaker: THERESA
dialogues.text: Standing in the doorway.   Hands on her hips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, hi, Theresa. Just tellin' the kids about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, but I'll tuck the kids in. Say good night to Uncle Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But we want to hear the rest of the story... Theresa silences Quincy with a look.   Sensing his cue, Lowrey kisses the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'night, gang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: G'night, Uncle Mike. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                             60.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey is seated on the couch, loading clips and dressing his weapon on the coffee table. As he pours a Coke, Theresa appears at the bottom of the stairwell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were my husband, I'd poison that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you were my wife I'd drink it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Twelve years I'm married, Michael. And I never let Marcus bring his work home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a harmless bedtime story. Thought the kids deserved to know about the hero they have for a dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't need any violence in this household and we certainly don't need any more heroes. What we need is a father and a husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Husband? Theresa. He's your personal errand boy. You beep the poor S.O.B. every hour on the Goddamn hour? And why is it always about some useless bullshit that can wait until later. I mean, the guy's gotta job to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna know why I page him? Because until that phone rings, I don't know whether he's dead or alive. And lemme tell you. Those three minutes I'm waiting for him to call back? Those are the hardest three minutes for a cop's wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (toasts with the Coke)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Touche, Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                               61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheets and pillows are in the hope chest. I'll see you in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noah's car is parked down the block.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With night vision goggles they glass the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA STARTS ON a beautiful SHOT of Julie sleeping in the bedroom, then PULLS BACK AND SWIVELS to reveal Burnett on the couch. Gun laid across his chest. He lays awake while Luke and Duke sniff at his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey unhappily pulls into the parking lot driving Burnett's dilapidated Volvo. Ruiz and Sanchez, walking from the cars, spot him and laugh as he climbs out of the wreck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, mean machine, Lowrey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should recognize trunk. It's the one you came to America in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't come from Cuba by car, asshole. Lowrey walks by his own cherished Porsche on the way in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey and Burnett on a roll.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                                 6

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' you, I've      had it with this witness. I wanna       go home and get back to my life as      it was. I got married so I could      stop lyin'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please. Big fucking deal. You know what I had to do? I drove your kids to school this morning. Your son forgot his homework. So I had to drive him all the way back in that junker of yours -- (as if looking at Burnett for the first time)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that you're wearin'? Is that my new silk shirt? Is that my shirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I know, it's a little big on me. But cool. I figure, what about it? If I'm gonna be Mike, might as well dress like Mike! (singing)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wanna be, I wanna be like Mike. Swish. Lowrey's BEEPER SOUNDS.    He checks out the number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ugh.   I gotta call the wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The wife? Lowrey finds the nearest phone and dials.      Burnett is thinking Theresa?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, what's up, baby. Uh-huh. (pulls out notepad)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Okay. What else? You want me do what? Lowrey glances over at Burnett who's clearly loving the fact that it's Lowrey's turn at errand boy. So Lowrey...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/23/94 (PM)                        62A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mmm. Uh-huh. Hectic down here. I'll be in, nine. Nine-thirty. The kids alright? How's that potty thing? Yeah? Okay. Alright. Lowrey turns to block the phone, depressing the switch, but acting as if he's still on with Theresa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, why don't you rent a movie or somethin'? Uh-huh. (teasing laugh)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're so silly. Burnett's burning now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, baby.   What you wearin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gimme that phone. (grabs it)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello, Theresa? Theresa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, it's off. It was a joke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man. Don't mess with me! That's the mother of my children. Don't break up a happy home. A132   INT. SAVE-MORE DRUGS - MORNING (Formerly Sc. 207) Lowrey is annoyed. He holds the list Theresa just gave him as they walk down the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, this is crazy. We are five minutes away from picking up this asshole and returning to our lives. And we're here doin' this shit. Where the fuck is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. Don't ask me to find it for you. You're the expert on my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/23/94 (PM)                         62B.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, this is like some really bizarre shit that you're on right now. Your wife asked me to do this, and I'm doin' it. Besides, I'm you, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even know where you're going. You're in the wrong aisle. Lowrey follows Burnett to the next aisle, where Burnett gestures to the wall of feminine hygiene products.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you know what Theresa needs, man, but I do this every month. (challenges)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just look for 'Fresh Days.' Lowrey moves ahead.   There's too much to look at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're unbalanced. Listen, I read the parole jacket on this guy Noah. Armed robbery. Attempted murder. He's a violent offender somethin' like nine times. Sweet guy. Not a single drug bust on his sheet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So? He's a new recruit. Keep looking, will ya? 'Fresh Days.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it is a damn shame she makes you buy this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, this what husband's do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terrible fuckin' job. (examining shelves)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like shaving cream. They're all the same. Fresh. Free. Confident. Secure. (grabs a box)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Super wide? What the fuck? We're takin' this one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/23/94 (PM)                        62C.

dialogues.speaker: A132 CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Burnett snatches Lowrey's box and puts it back on the shelf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man, look! You're not even reading. These are panty liners, okay? A woman chooses this moment to walk by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a whole 'nother category of thing! Man, for a guy that spends all his time chasing pussy, you sure don't know much about the woo woo. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here it is. Fresh Days. You pay for it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett and Lowrey park and pop the trunk.    Inside are guns and uniforms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are we gonna be today? Postal Inspectors or Water and Power?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water and Power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Approaching are Burnett and Lowrey, but now they're dressed in shorts and T-shirts with bright orange vests and caps reading "Water and Power." And as Lowrey knocks on the door.

dialogues.speaker: HEAVY LINK CHAIN
dialogues.text: Wrapped around a pink refrigerator.    It moves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think the chain's for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I dunno. Maybe some kind of hurricane anchor. They knock again.    The chain jerks slightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the anchor just moved. Both turn and look. And the chain is moving. At first, it simply sways back and forth, then it pulls taut and the FRIDGE JOLTS! A deep, GUTTURAL NOISE sounds. From around the corner, a shadow grows large. Lowrey and Burnett instinctively withdraw their guns and aim just as a LION rounds the corner, teeth bared, claws tearing at the deck. The door swings open. Burnett pushes Lowrey inside just as the big cat lunges.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey and Burnett are holding the door against the GROWLING LION.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/21/94                               64.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?! Lowrey and Burnett heave, then turn. They're equally shocked to find a huge, three-hundred-pound WOMAN in nothing but her underwear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AAAAAAAAAAA-Animal Control!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But your uniforms say Water and Power!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're undercover! Now, we're lookin' for the owner of that animal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen. The cat don't belong to me. It belong to my brother. And I don't know where he is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad. Because his lion's tied to your trailer. So you gotta move the beast. Or move the trailer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move the trailer? Move it to where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everglades. Only part of South Florida that's zoned for Wild Kingdom shit. 'Course, the crocks down there'll probably eat your brother's cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But he loves that lion! Raised him from a little kitty!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, little kitty's gonna be gator bait 'less you suddenly remember where your brother is. By the look on her face, her memory is coming back. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94                                64

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey and Burnett pull up in the unmarked police car. Chet is there to help with the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to each of them)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'Morning, Mr. Lowrey. 'Morning, Mr. Lowrey. Burnett grabs Lowrey and yanks him toward the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keys in the door and Burnett and Lowrey enter the apartment. Julie's DOGS run up to them, YAPPING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's me, Julie... Julie enters from the bedroom, dressed in something hot with the tag still hanging from a sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll be ready in just a minute. I thought I'd have you tell -- She stalls at the sight of Lowrey, a little spark of interest passes between them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Julie. You must be Marcus. (hand outstretched)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I recognize you from all the photographs. Nice to meet you. (turns around for Burnett)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very nice.   The occasion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He said we were going to a club tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. We were going to a club.     As in me and my partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94                            65.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh,  that's fuckin' swell! And you call  this protective custody? I'm here  all day. I'm alone and scared. And  all I got to protect me is Chet the  doorman --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that on the rug?    Looks like... a stain? Teeth grit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was my babies, Luke and Duke. They get nervous in new surroundings. I offered to pay for the cleaning, but Mike wouldn't hear of it -- Lowrey spots rings from glasses on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And have you ever heard of a new invention called the 'coaster'? As he tries buffing the table with his sleeve.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: She might be catching on here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, you act like it's your place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's not my place. My wife. She's a designer. She decorated the whole place at a discount just for Mike. And when she hears about how he's been taking care of -- (glares witheringly at dogs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off the couch! Lowrey chases the dogs into the bedroom. One of the dogs runs out with a Cole Hahn loafer in his mouth. They both follow him into the bedroom. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94                              66.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the lock on the front door turns. The door opens. A mysterious WOMAN in an overcoat, sunglasses and spiked heels enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike? The Woman strips off the overcoat -- under which she's breathtakingly naked, save for a garter belt and stockings. She drapes the coat over the nearest chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm feeling really nasty right now. Burnett is first to appear from the bedroom -- and his expression goes off the charts. Startled, the woman shrugs back into her coat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who the hell are you? Burnett charges her, instantly ushering her to the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you get in here? Julie and Lowrey return from the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a key.     But, Mike...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you should call first next time. What's your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yvette!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't quit stalking me, Yvette, I'm gonna place your ass under arrest! -- 'Bye! Burnett slams the door. She's SCREAMING on the other side, POUNDING the door with her fists, and cursing in mad Spanish. Finally she stomps off down the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 'The hell's going on out here??

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                            67.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just that crazy Yvette, stalking me again. Lowrey could kill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yvette!? You didn't just send away Yvette?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That woman's into some weird shit. Julie's confused, to say the least.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Burnett)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Mike. Any other spontaneous naked women with keys, that we should know about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We, as in Marcus and I, are going to Club Hell. We're gonna nail this Noah guy and get him to give up Max's shooter. Anyone got a problem with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel safer now. She turns and exits back into the bedroom. Burnett's about to follow when Lowrey swings him outside the door- way and gets into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are ruining my life!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well this case is messin' with mine, too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ultimate Miami night scene. A long line of local and Hip and cool couples are waiting. Lowrey and Burnett appear at the front of the line, coolly flashing their badges to a hipster couple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                          68.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man. Got some bad news. Your car got busted into. There's some uniformed boys in the parking lot wanting to ask you some questions. Pissed and panicked, the hipster pair head for the parking lot, while Lowery and Burnett take their place near the front of the line. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                                69

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie, still dressed for the evening, paces back and forth. Frustrated, she rips the tag from her dress, and sits back down at the computer. She plays with the keyboard and Noah's mug shot pops back into view. She stares at it a little too intently. Images flash in front of her, the sights and sounds of Max's death replaying itself in her mind. Snapping out of it, determined, she gathers her bag and exits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hip. Hard rock. Crowded. Sexy. Burnett and Lowrey on cruise control, this club massed with people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High above the room, Fouchet looks out upon the dance floor with both Noah, Casper, and Ferguson behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My three little angels told me I'd get a visit from the cops tonight and there they are. (turns and orders)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When they split up, we'll drop the tall one and get the other one to lead us to the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey and Burnett move to the bar.   There's a huge fishtank behind it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say we split the room in half. Make our own moves. Hook back up at the bar in twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sounds good to me. Lowrey moves off and Burnett turns to the female BARTENDER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: 'Evening, Mr. Lowrey. May I have a word with you? (pulls him aside)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was thinking that... maybe I could see your gun. See, we don't allow guns up in the apartments. Mr. Lowrey usually checks his, here, at the desk with me... You want me to check yours? Burnett pulls his gun. But doesn't hand it to Chet. sticks it in Chet's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, okay.   It's just an option. Burnett grabs Julie's hand and heads for the elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cigar-smoking Sinclair supervises the lock-down of the Special Narcotics Unit. Desks are being locked by IA suits.

dialogues.speaker: BURNETT AND LOWREY
dialogues.text: enter.   Just as file cabinets are hand-trucked by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.   What's goin' on here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait a minute. That's my desk! Lowrey's going to make a move on Sinclair when Howard appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                             88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah. It's exactly how it looks. I.A.'s shutting us down. We're all being reassigned until their investigation is over. In here. Howard pushes them into --

dialogues.speaker: HOWARD'S OFFICE
dialogues.text: Where Ruiz and Sanchez wait with one of last night's Henchmen. His face is horribly bruised.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He says he wants his lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but we told him we were desperate men without no fuckin' jobs, so... (prods the guy)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. All I know is his name. Foo-shay, I think. Got this heavy French accent. The word was he offs drug dealers. And there was quick cash for whoever had the balls enough to hook up with him. I swear, man, watchin' your house was my first gig for the guy. Burnett stands over the Henchman and lifts his defeated chin to face him. Burnett has it in him to give the guy one more hard whack for good measure, but that bruised face proves punishment enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I guess you're tellin' the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also got the lab report from the stuff you picked up in Noah's trunk. He hands it off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                             88

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insert substance... Highly volatile drying agent? The greedy motherfucker! He's cutting the dope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but Julie told me his ship comes in on Friday? You wanna tell me who can cut a hundred mil worth a dope in five days? You'd need whole lotta time cards to make that kinda date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Or one really smart sonofabitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're    in the shit, boys. And there    ain't gonna be any more time cards    for this unit unless somebody pulls    a miracle out of their ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's handcuffed to the steering wheel again, semi- draped in the front seat. She can't believe it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm getting really tired of this shit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a yawning, tire graveyard for used and crude tires. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/23/94 (PM)                         89.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two old codgers are trading stories in front of JOJO, a white boy with rasta dreadlocks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Jojo. Through the office window, Jojo sees Burnett and sud- denly bolts out the rear door and runs smack dab into Lowrey, who body checks him back up against the office door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good runnin' into you, Jojo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Burnett has pushed Jojo up onto the sink.   Lowrey hangs back, vibrating with anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, calm down. A little rap, that's all. We're lookin' for someone who can step on a shitload of heroin. And do it real fast, and real well. We're lookin' for a pro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in the rubber business now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not playin' around with you, Jojo. You know what we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm tellin' you straight up, like a straight fuckin' arrow, okay? I'm straight as a board. I'm so straight it's fuckin' sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now there's a lotta dope, Jojo. Who can cut it quick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean, cut it... cut it up, yeah. I don't know anything about anything. Lowrey's had it.   He pulls his gun and pushes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/23/94 (PM)                          90.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, man.     I can't believe you're puttin' a    gun on me. You're a cop. I turn you    into 'Hard Copy,' man. Put you on    the T.V. set.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doin', man? As Burnett tries to intercede, they talk over each other.

dialogues.speaker: LOWREY BURNETT
dialogues.text: We don't got time for            Mike. Chill with that. this. Jojo, I'm gonna            No. Don't do it! This kill you, man. I've got          is illegal! He's just fifteen bullets and I'm          a white ganja-smokin' gonna fill your rasta            motherfucker. He ain't ass fulla some hot               worth it. shit... (reaches behind his back) Wait. Wait. Burnett pushes in one last time and tries to talk Lowrey back. Lowrey acts like he lost it. He pulls another gun and points it at Burnett.

dialogues.speaker: LOWREY BURNETT
dialogues.text: Back up. I'm gonna bust          Right on. Jojo, you're your fuckin' ass too.            on your own. (then, back to                   (as he walks away) Jojo)                        I'm sorry for you, Jojo. Talk to me. Tell me what         I was on your side. I'll I want to know. I'll do          just be over here. I you man, say it. Come on.        don't want no skull fragments or brain shit on me. When that shit flies, it don't wash off.

dialogues.speaker: JOJO
dialogues.text: scared shitless.   He's gonna die.   These are some crazy motherfuckers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (chimes in again)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, partner. He's no good to us if you splatter his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/23/94 (PM)                91.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay. I definitely don't know for sure. But I know a little for sure. Three guys... well, two guys and one of them's dead. Crazy rocket-scientist, Einstein fuckin' guy. Got some rich mommy and daddy. Tell you where he's at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (holsters guns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, it's a good thing you got your memory workin'. Cuz that dead man paperwork is a bitch. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                             91

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Staked out around the corner are Burnett and Lowrey. Each is clearly tired of the other. The silence is deadly until Julie breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So where's the coffee and donuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought that was the usual menu when cops were on stakeout. A little caffeine for the heart. Some sugar-coated dough fried in day old grease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man. Will you get off this? You're making me sick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I'm sorry, Marcus. All     these hours on the case, you must    miss Theresa's home cooking. (near Lowrey's ear)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bet last night she fixed you    up something yummy and left it    in the microwave for you. Burnett starts to steam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Somethin' yummy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I imagine there was something yummy waiting for you when you finally made it to bed --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wheels)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, lady -- But Burnett's face    ignites with headlights at their rear. Doors open.      Lowrey checks the rear-view mirror He sees two private    security cops named DE SOUZA and TOWNE. They split     and approach either side of the unmarked sedan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, man.     It's the fuckin' pretend police.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                             92

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Be nice. After tomorrow we might need 'em for a job reference. Lowrey rolls down his driver's window in time to hear...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, what do we have back here? Looks like we got us two pimps and a hooker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fellahs. Maybe if she does us both we'll let you leave with your pride intact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. One moment. (rolls up the window)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's fuck with these bozos. Burnett nods his approval.   Lowrey lowers the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, where were we?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outta the car. Hands where we can see 'em. Feet spread. Both hobby cops open the doors for Lowrey and Burnett respectively. Looks pass between them as they step out and assume the positions. And Towne starts by frisking Burnett's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, that's not how you frisk a potential lawbreaker. You gotta start at the waistband. See if he's carrying a piece. Towne stalls a beat, then self-consciously goes to Burnett's waistband where he feels a --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gun! Both hobby cops instantly withdraw, their own pieces drawn and leveled on Burnett and Lowrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                          93.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoah. You better watch it, fellahs! (very slowly)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, it would be very bad if you shot and killed two helpless pimps and a call girl... But it would be even worse if you shot two policemen and their witness on a stakeout. Looks pass between the hobby cops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (slowly turns)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now I'm reaching slowly for my shield... very slowly... here it comes... just about got it... (reveals his badge)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooh, look at that. It's a detective's shield! All gold and shiny. A smart fellah wouldn't fuck with somebody who had one of these in his pocket. So... Let's see. I guess that makes us policemen. And you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not. He shows his shield. Both hobby cops lower their guns, unsure about what's next. Burnett moves in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, some rent-a-cops have licenses to carry weapons,  where others do not. Which might   you be? You wouldn't happen to   have those permits handy, would  you? From the looks on the hobby cops' faces, Julie can see that they don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guess we know the answer to that one. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: De Souza and Towne lay face down and cuffed on the pavement while the CAMERA LIFTS BACK TO the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet you miss your wife, kids... I bet you miss them a whole lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't worry. They're in good hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa gives a peek out the window.       There's anothe suspicious car on the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanchez and Ruiz are on protective duty in front of Burnett's house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you kidding, man? Desi was the brains behind the whole operation. That's why they called their company Desilu. Desi was first. Lucy second. Get it? Desi-Lu?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coral Gables stakeout. Julie's passed out and, once again, sleeping in the rear of the car. In the glow of the faltering streetlights and the approaching dawn, she couldn't look more beautiful. And from his post in the driver's seat, he's looking at her with a longing that goes well beyond lust. Then Burnett breaks the silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two o'clock.     The red Civic.

dialogues.speaker: FROM STAKEOUT CAR
dialogues.text: Elliot shutting the door to his little red Civic, jangling keys as he's hurrying up the walk to the front door. He looks like he hasn't slept or showered in days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's just hope he didn't come home for a nap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elliot exits the house in a hurry. Hair wet from a shower and fresh change of clothes. He fumbles with the keys to his Civic, gets in and drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm on him. (to Julie)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, buckle up back there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wha...? Lowrey has the keys in the ignition and is stomping on the gas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tailing scene as Lowrey and Burnett tail Elliot through morning traffic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey and Burnett's unmarked sedan stops about two hundred yards from the freighter.

dialogues.speaker: MORNING
dialogues.text: Elliot's out of the car in a flash and crawling aboard the ship. But as he disappears, Casper appears with his own pair of binoculars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've made us. Let's move. Lowrey FLOORS it. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                               96.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowrey's driving in his typical, pedal to the metal style while Burnett talks on the radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Tell Howard to assemble the troops. We just made the dope lab. We'll be at the P.D. in one hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what am I gonna do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna keep your sweet ass nice and quiet back at my place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike's place.     I said Mike's. Lowrey rolls his eyes.    He can't wait for this to end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Typical pandemonium. Theresa is making/serving breakfast while the TV BLARES. Quincy is channel surfing on the TV when he comes up with the news footage of the explosion, followed by more footage of Lowrey, Julie, and Burnett at the scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, it's Dad and Uncle Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In our continuing report on police violence, the most recent incident involving two Miami P.D. officers remains unexplained by department spokesmen. This high-speed chase was captured two nights ago by our Live Copter 9 news team. And while the driver was killed, both police officers involved in the incident seemed to escape without injury.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids, you go over to the neighbors' house. I'll be right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                              97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where you going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy's going to Cleveland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bang, they're through the door.   Grubby and tired from the all-night stakeout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa enters building, ignores Chet and heads straight for bank of elevators.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lady, all visitors must be announced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Announce this! In a motherly flash, she's got Chet by the ear and she's dragging him over to the elevator. He yowls the whole way until he sticks his master pass-card in the elevator lock. Theresa lets  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie is framed in the bedroom doorway, somewhat sadly watching Burnett and Lowrey scramble to get ready for the bust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I guess when you get back, it's gonna be over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the plan... So, Mike. Loan some of those ass kicking clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Third drawer down. (as doorbell rings)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Julie. Do me a favor and see who that is. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                                98

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie looks through the peephole, then opens the door. And there's Theresa. Julie's hip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one do you want?     The tall one or the short one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I got plenty in me to kill 'em both. But it's the short one I'm gonna divorce. She pushes past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thought so. Julie watches Theresa charge headlong into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett's stripped to his pants and T-shirt. While Lowrey's down to his white boxer shorts. He's talking and wiping down his gun with a rag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Man, I can't wait to see the look on Howard's face when we tell him... (seeing Theresa)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Holy shit! Hi, Theresa... honey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Save your crap, Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mike what?     What'd he do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa.     It's not how it looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It ain't Cleveland, neither.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Julie? Lowrey pushes past Theresa into --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Julie is gone!    The front door is wide open. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                            99.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie's inside. She hits the close door button.    But Lowrey's there to catch it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie. We wanted to tell you... I especially wanted to tell you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I didn't know? God, you are so stupid! And to think I let you use me like you did, Max. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait. I know why. Because you said you needed me. Jesus, who's the stupid one now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still need you. He reaches for her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you! Julie slams a fist into Lowrey's face. The elevator doors shut. Then Burnett comes hauling down the corridor with Theresa at his heels. He pounds the elevator button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stayed away from home just one night too many, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theresa. She's a material witness! It was orders!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The elevator doors open and Julie makes for exit. She sees a cab parked outside, slips back on her spiked heel and starts to run for it when --

dialogues.speaker: FOUCHET
dialogues.text: enters, with Casper and Ferguson to either side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                            99A

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They sweep into the lobby, stalling just inside the doorway when they realize that their target is right there in front of them, frozen like a deer caught in the proberbial headlights. To the right and left, people at the mailboxes. Chet on the phone behind the desk. But he's looking at Julie. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grab her. But the doors to the second elevator open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                                10

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Burnett and Lowrey step out in time to see Julie looking to them and the bad guys about to make their move.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE
dialogues.text: Fouchet and his henchmen LEFT. Burnett and Lowrey to the RIGHT. And Julie in the MIDDLE. Fouchet is the first one to draw down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie!   Drop now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pandemonium. GUNS drawn and BLAZING. All three villains, plus Burnett and Lowrey, diving and FIRING.

dialogues.speaker: PEOPLE IN LOBBY
dialogues.text: Scream and duck for cover.     Smoke and plaster fill the air.

dialogues.speaker: BURNETT
dialogues.text: Pushes Theresa back into the elevator, making her lay on the floor as BULLETS CUT above.

dialogues.speaker: LOWREY
dialogues.text: Slips behind a pillar as BULLETS WHIZ past.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: On floor.    In the middle.   Crawling for cover when --

dialogues.speaker: FOUCHET
dialogues.text: With balls the size of Pennsylvania. Two GUNS in hand, walks forward with barrels fixed and FIRING. Clips out on one, tosses the gun aside, then, with his free hand, reaches down and grabs Julie by the hair and lifts her until she stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/22/94                                10

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: With a gun in her side, he backs away and shoves her through the exit. Casper and Ferguson follow.

dialogues.speaker: LOWREY
dialogues.text: Swings around the pillar, gun leveled and running after them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie!!!! Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into the open elevator, Burnett slides his gun over to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go upstairs. And don't let anybody in but me... Do it! Burnett presses the close door button. The doors close just as Theresa reaches for him, calling --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fouchet shoves Julie into a waiting car. All three bad guys pile in and the CAR PEELS RUBBER just as Lowrey makes the doorway. Lowrey doesn't stop. He doesn't even wait for traffic. In nothing but his underwear, he appears from the building, turns the corner out the door, launches into traffic like a shot, spinning off bumpers, chasing Fouchet's car on foot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fouchet's car slides into the intersection and stalled traffic. To the right: a footbridge. The car swings a hard right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where a male nurse pushing an old man in a wheelchair are in the way. SLAM! The nurse tumbles up and into Fouchet's windshield.

dialogues.speaker: WHEELCHAIR
dialogues.text: Empty and spinning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metal pylons imbedded in concrete.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of the car! The doors fly open and all three are out in the middle of the stalled traffic, Julie being drug along with them. The gang cuts down an alley.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turns the corner, running up over car roofs and hoods. He lowers his gun and tries to draw a bead on Fouchet and the gang. They've got Julie and now they're running.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Appears behind Lowrey. Lowrey waves him in another direction. Burnett hauls one way. Lowrey the other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUZAK. Old ladies getting their hair blued and curled when -- BANG! Fouchet and the gang enter. Curlers fly. Screams!

dialogues.speaker: LOWREY
dialogues.text: enters. He dives to the floor as Casper stops and FIRES. BULLETS RIP through the salon walls and mirrors. Lowrey ends up under an old lady's dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exiting the beauty salon and stumbling through a crowded cafe runs Fouchet and the gang, mauling their way through tables and patrons. Lowrey, only moments behind, pushing his way through the same path.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fouchet stops right in the middle. Picks the first car that's headed for him. Levels a GUN on a taxi cab and FIRES two quick rounds -- BAM BAM!! The driver of the car instantly slumps. Ferguson's seen this before. He's around to the driver's side of the car, pulling the dead man out and leaving him on the street. Casper and Fouchet shove Julie inside and they're off again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But here comes Burnett. Crossing traffic. He's got no gun. So he jumps aboard Fouchet's car just as it gets into gear. The WHEELS SPIN. The CAR LURCHES ahead.

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE CAB
dialogues.text: Ferguson aims his pistol upward. He's about to fire into the roof when Julie shoves him. GUNSHOTS RING out sideways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BULLETS RIP to either side of Burnett. Then Fouchet stomps on the brake and Burnett tumbles forward and onto the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: BURNETT
dialogues.text: He rolls, makes it to one knee.   But his other leg gives way.

dialogues.speaker: FOUCHET
dialogues.text: He sees his chance and GUNS the ENGINE. The cab barrels at Burnett, who's stuck in the middle of the boulevard, about to become instant roadkill. Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From out of nowhere, here comes Lowrey. Dashing out across the boulevard and snatching his partner from the deadly grille of the cab.

dialogues.speaker: TAXI CAB
dialogues.text: hauls on by. Leaving Burnett and Lowrey in a heap of their own, both trying to catch their breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't ever say I wasn't there for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAC teams and uniform cops swarm around their cars. All waiting as Burnett and Lowrey arrive in their unmarked car. Howard approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about fuckin' time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We lost the girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you found the dope, right? So let's go get it back. A bicycle BELL RINGS. Heads turn. And here comes a BOY on his bike, serpentining his way through the maze of cars and cops until he gets to Lowrey, Burnett, and Howard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which one of you's Lowrey?   I got somethin' for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At least I'm me again. (hand out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Lowrey. From his back pocket, the boy extracts a cellular flip PHONE. He hands it to Lowrey. He presses the power button and, almost instantly, it RINGS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (presses send)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   This is Lowrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While dope is lifted and loaded from the open hold, Fouchet is revealed at the other end of the cellular call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have something for you to listen to. Fouchet lifts his PISTOL and FIRES a single shot.   BAM!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He jolts at the sound of GUNFIRE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where the CAMERA SWISH PANS ACROSS TO a very dead Elliot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That bullet just killed the chemist. Now, I have but four hours left to make my deal. Fuck with my timetable and the next bullet kills the girl. Julie is gagged and sitting on the floor, scared shitless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's in a vice.    Duty or the girl.   Then --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You twisted motherfucker... (then...)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jojo, you sonofabitch. When I get my hands on you, I swear, I'm gonna kill you. (hangs up)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The snitch who tipped us to the dope lab? Turns out to be a bogus address.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bogus address?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's this? I'll kill the little prick for you. That's cuz you're already dead. (waves at the troops)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, you guys. Put 'em back in the lockers.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: En masse, all the cops act as if the wind had been knocked from their sails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty, save for the daytime regulars at the bar and Burnett and Lowrey in a rear booth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd he know we were gearing up to go? It's like he's known all along where we're gonna be and when.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know that once he sells the dope, he's gonna kill her just like he did Max.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three little angels. Julie kept talking about his three little angels. A barkeeper appears with two beers.   Burnett automati- cally reaches for his wallet.

dialogues.speaker: BURNETT'S WALLET
dialogues.text: Where out pops a picture of his three children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If she dies, I'm done with it. The whole cop thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking at his kids)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three little angels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francine is at her file desk. Looking pretty much the same as always. Same smile. Same easy manner. Then the CAMERA REVOLVES AROUND her and SETTLES ON those pictures on her desk. Her three little boys -- including the one in uniform. The CAMERA TILTS TO --

dialogues.speaker: LOWREY AND BURNETT
dialogues.text: standing over her desk.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Neither of them smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, fellahs. What's the joke. (as she gets nothing back)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really. I want to know. Soon, though, the facade fades.   Francine knows she's been caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett holds the door while Lowrey holds Francine. She's broken, crying, and giving up the ghost of her past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was a birthday party... You know, after hours. Just the civilian staff... We were drinking. And everybody. They all had boy friends or their husbands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you were alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was so nice to me. He said I was beautiful, too. I guess I wanted to believe him... (then ashamed, starting to shake)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He took some horrible pictures of me. I don't remember any of it. I'd had too much to drink. I wondered if he'd drugged me. Later... he threatened to show them to my boys... my little angels. Said he'd pin the pictures up on the grade school bulletin boards for all their classmates to see if I didn't do what he wanted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He wanted someone inside the P.D.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first, it was about drug busts. Dealers under surveillance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He'd steal from them before we could make the case. And then when the department gave the air conditioning to Mr. Orona...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anything you can tell us about him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say about someone who rips off drug dealers? A man like that ain't scared of nobody. Not the police. Not you guys. Nobody. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's the scariest man I ever met.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. But does he still trust what you tell him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fouchet is supervising the loading of the dope onto three canvas-backed, military-styled trucks when his CELLULAR PHONE RINGS. He answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Francine is on the phone with Howard on another extension.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have some more information for you, Mr. Fouchet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Florida Power van.   Inside...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Burnett and Lowrey wearing headsets, listening in on the conversation between Fouchet and Francine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's surprised to hear from Francine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Francine... What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miami P.D.'s called in the D.E.A. task force. They know the deal's going down in just two hours. So they've deployed agents to every point of entry, airports, marinas, etc...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm very pleased, Francine. You're the best pet I've ever had. He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the van Lowrey turns to Sanchez.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Got him! Ma Bell says as long as he keeps his cellular phone turned on, we can track him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call Howard. Tell him we're gonna need lotsa back-up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three trucks making their way through Miami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferguson is seated and staring across at Julie. Across his lap is a shotgun. She may be bruised and abused. But she's still got some bite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I forget the formula. Big gun, big dick? No. Little gun, big dick? No. Big gun, little dick? Yeah. Yeah. I think that's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA ZEROES IN ON his cellular phone.    The power light is green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanchez gives the update.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're turning north onto the Orange Highway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can make better time if we cut across the Biscayne Bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The van cuts across traffic, barely making the ramp which swirls up onto the bridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dope convoy rolls OVER the CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: DAY
dialogues.text: As the convoy makes a right turn off the highway onto an old tar and gravel track.

dialogues.speaker: AIRFIELD
dialogues.text: The trucks roll toward an old airport which consists of a small, pilot's terminal and four or so hangars spread out over the ten acre site.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two henchmen for the buyer open the yawning doors of this massive, five-story hangar to reveal a C-123 cargo aircraft. The convoy of trucks enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The surveillance van is parked at the side of the road.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THROUGH a floor-mounted SPOTTING SCOPE we see the last of the trucks roll into Hangar 3 and two of the buyer's henchmen shut the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it. That's where they're making the deal. Burnett swivels the spotting scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PANNING LEFT AND RIGHT ACROSS the landscape of tall reeds and distant buildings. Finally he STALLS ON a garbage truck and its four-man crew rolling dumpsters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fouchet shakes  hands with the BUYER. Upon which time one forklift begins  to drive pallets full of cash from the open cargo door  of the aircraft while another drives pallets full of  dope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred million and very, very fresh. Too much to count, eh?

dialogues.speaker: ON JULIE
dialogues.text: As Casper pulls her from the rear of a truck and handcuffs her to the door of a cab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's the bimbo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Simply part of another transaction.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The operation moves swiftly. Dope pallets for cash pallets. Smooth, just like the original heist. Two fuel trucks are moved in to gas up the aircraft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rounding the corner from Hangar 3 -- here comes the garbage truck. CLOSER INSPECTION REVEALS Ruiz and Sanchez at the helm with both Lowrey and Burnett hanging from the sides. All of them wear dirty white jumpsuits and protective masks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Buyer's henchmen stiffen at the sight of the oncoming truck. Their hands slip inside their coats to MP5-Ks slung under their armpits. But --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It veers and swings over toward two nearby dumpsters. With Sanchez keeping a wary eye on the two bad guys and Ruiz to operate the hydraulics, Burnett and Lowrey drop from the truck and do their best working-for-the-city amble over to the dumpster. Business as usual. They wheel it over and position it in front of the two lifting forks where the garbage appears to be expertly lifted and dumped into the truck.

dialogues.speaker: DUMPSTER
dialogues.text: As it lowers, the gearing seems to get hung up. The hydraulics' arms won't work, leaving the dumpster stuck in the air.

dialogues.speaker: RUIZ AND SANCHEZ
dialogues.text: Begin speaking Spanish, one blaming the other for this fiasco. Angry words. Finally, Ruiz has had enough. tosses down his gloves and hat and begins stomping off if he's just quit his stinking job. He's headed right the henchmen, his mouth moving and spewing and moving spewing. The henchmen look to each other, not knowing what to think. Ready for anything when -- CLICK CLICK -- GUNS COCKING. Both Burnett and Lowrey are right behind the henchmen wit guns at the base of their necks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mouths shut, feet moving.    Now, walk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it lifts once again to the air, this time dumping the two henchmen into the truck.

dialogues.speaker: HIGH ABOVE TRUCK
dialogues.text: As the human garbage is deposited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Buyer buckles himself into the pilot's seat of the C- 123. His crew shuts the cargo hatches and he gives a pleased salute to Fouchet. The ENGINES TURN OVER and the propellers move. Meanwhile --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: START. Loaded with cash, they're ready to go.   Fouchet gives the signal to open the doors.

dialogues.speaker: CASPER AND FERGUSON
dialogues.text: Move to open the doors. They give a good shove.   Still nothing. So they bang and shout.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Wake up out there!     Open it up!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the dumpsters is parked in front of the doors.   N exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Casper and Ferguson give a helpless look to Fouchet...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The garbage truck barrels through the rear wall, instantly colliding with the left wing section of aircraft. The wheel assembly buckles and the aircraft twists onto one wing. Fuel spills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tossed from his seat and thrown across throttle.   The

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tarpaulin rips and a pallet of cash busts open. Money swirls inside the hangar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Open.   Henchmen ready to kill.   Then --

dialogues.speaker: FROM EMPTY DUMPSTER
dialogues.text: Pop up Burnett and Lowrey. MP5-Ks in hand. They BLAZE the cargo doors and CUT DOWN the rest of the Buyer's henchmen.

dialogues.speaker: CASPER AND FERGUSON
dialogues.text: charge.   GUNS BLASTING.

dialogues.speaker: BULLETS
dialogues.text: RIP across the dumpster, moving up into the truck cab. Ruiz and Sanchez dive and roll to either side. Meanwhile, the sparks ignite the spilled fuel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Move it or lose it! Burnett and Lowrey climb from the dumpster and run. Casper and Ferguson have a clear shot. They level and aim, but...

dialogues.speaker: KUH-WHOOM
dialogues.text: The FUEL TANK on the aircraft EXPLODES. The truck drivers dive for cover. Charging for the open hole in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inside the aircraft the precious dope catches fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking through the flames. Shielding their eyes.     Rui and Sanchez appear from behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember us? The two bad guys turn with their guns. The flames igniting their already battered faces. But they don't turn fast enough. Both cops FIRE in unison. Ferguson and Casper fall. PULL BACK --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One aircraft ENGINE still ROARING. The money swirling and burning, falling from the roof like a fiery rain. And --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easing through the wreckage, ever-so-cautious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael! Her VOICE ECHOES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's handcuffed himself to Julie, dragging her deeper and deeper into the hangar. The smoke is getting thicker and swirling with the burning cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Signals between the two. They split wider.   Moving toward those locked doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At the locked doors. He shoves against them in a futile rage. Julie begins to choke on the fumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Each placing their faces against their own sleeves.    Th smoke is thicker, swirling in waves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shoving the doors.   Pushing and pushing.    Then --

dialogues.speaker: FROM HAIL OF SMOKE AND BURNING CASH
dialogues.text: Appear Lowrey and Burnett. Twenty yards apart and closing. Guns carefully aimed. Fouchet pulls Julie close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was going to fuck her, then kill her. Now it looks like I'm only going to do the latter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Either we O.D. on the air or the whole place blows. We're dying anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let her go and you'll walk. You can keep the dope and the money. (coughs)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the girl and we all get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I don't have the key.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He threw it in the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yanks her)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up! It's gone. She's dead. Unless you move aside. Burnett eases further right. Gun carefully aimed. His eyes are stinging. Lowrey goes left. But he's lowering his gun.

dialogues.speaker: FOUCHET
dialogues.text: Pulls Julie closer. Gun at her head. Looking to Burnett. While Lowrey is nodding to Julie. Nodding for her to --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drop, Julie! She drops.    Burnett has a clear shot when --

dialogues.speaker: HANGAR DOORS
dialogues.text: Swing wide and way, way open. Blinding light. NOISE. HELICOPTERS. And about fifty cops at the ready. Rounds chambered. Rifles leveled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fouchet, Julie, Lowrey, Burnett. All with the same idea. They bolt for daylight as fast as they can go because --

dialogues.speaker: HANGAR
dialogues.text: EXPLODES in such a concussion it knocks all four of them to the dirt. The hangar crumbles.

dialogues.speaker: BURNETT
dialogues.text: As he looks back on the conflagration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanchez and Ruiz... Then --

dialogues.speaker: FOUCHET WITH JULIE
dialogues.text: He yanks her back up onto her feet, wild-eyed.   He's still got the gun on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hands up for all the cops to see)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't shoot!!! Hold your fire!!!

dialogues.speaker: FOUCHET
dialogues.text: Twisting Julie for all to see.    The cops' rifle sights, all glinting in the sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll kill the girl!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                            118

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Fouchet raises Julie's hand high in the air to show all of them the handcuffs when -- KA-POW! -- a SHOT RINGS OUT.

dialogues.speaker: CUFFS
dialogues.text: The link is snapped in two by the bullet.    Julie falls to the ground. While --

dialogues.speaker: BURNETT AND LOWREY
dialogues.text: UNLOAD their CLIPS in a CRESCENDO of GUNFIRE.    Fouchet crumples in a heap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The eye behind the smoking sniper rifle.    He reveals a pleasured smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Swish. Then he turns to Sinclair, who stands only feet away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Investigate that, asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She finds her feet and runs to Lowrey. Right into his arms. He holds her tight, but she winces from a nasty cut on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ow.     This shit really hurts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stick around. I'll give you a bullet to bite. Finally --

dialogues.speaker: SANCHEZ AND RUIZ
dialogues.text: They appear.   Alive and well. Big grins, helping Burnett to his feet.   Brushing him off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, hey... (then with a smile)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go get our jobs back. BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                             11

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens and all the little Burnetts come screaming out...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy Daddy Daddy the hero!!! ... into the arms of their father.     He gathers them al into one big hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy's home! Behind Burnett appear Lowrey and Julie, arm in arm. The kids run to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Mike, Uncle Mike. Then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baby! Theresa framed in the front doorway, looking smashing in the outfit Lowrey picked out for her. Burnett ambles up the walk into her arms. They hug and kiss, Theresa tossing a wink Lowrey's way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Manana, partner. Peace. Okay, kids. Pile in. And watch the leather and windows this time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got a real way with kids, Lowrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see anybody complaining?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.    Where are the kids goin'?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't you know? We got us a new babysitter. She kisses him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's quality time, Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD BOYS - Rev. 6/24/94 PM                              1

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Burnett shuts the door ON the CAMERA.    The screen GOES TO BLACK. Then UNDER CREDITS:

dialogues.speaker: OMITTED
dialogues.text: thru 304

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Little Megan is on the potty.   She catches Lowrey as he passes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uncle Mike.   I did it!
